channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-9262] Make KeyValue.KEY_COMPARATOR default for HFile WriterFactory
item.description:
This takes completed work mentioned in HBASE-9247 as a reasonably sized patch to build upon.

  • Fixed defaults in HFile.Writer factory to default to Key-format-aware comparator (KeyComparator, later converted to KVComparator) instead of a Key-format oblivious byte[] comparator. (Essentially all instances require specifying KEY_COMPARATOR – why not just make it the default).
    • Found that TestSeekTo, TestReseekTo and a handful of others depend on a different comparator because – HBASE-7845 "breaks" assumptions in these tests.
  • Moved getComparator into TableName. (removed an instanceof bad smell)
item.summary: Make KeyValue.KEY_COMPARATOR default for HFile WriterFactory

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Patch does above but also has these modifications:

  • Cleanup KeyValue#getType vs getTypeByte
  • Refactor/remove some gratuitous KeyValue constructors.
  • Privatizes some KeyValue methods.
  • Move KeyValue#getRowComparator to TableName#getRowComparator

+ final private static int len(byte[] b) {
+ return b == null ? 0 : b.length;

Do you want to check if an offset in the above?

Does this belong elsewhere? calcIndexKey? In KVUtil?

+1

Can fix above if you want on commit

I'll move it to KVUtil and do a pass to catch other instances of this pattern to make it more readable.

What do you think of applying this to 0.95/0.96? Parts of this starts to remove previously public (but seemingly esoteric) apis.
+1 I love removed code. On public APIs, deprecate first I'd say. Minimize how much we piss folks off.
Ok, I moved len to Bytes, and caught a few instances of it globally. For the 0.95 version i've deprecated the constructors I've removed, and deprecated the API's that I privatized in trunk.

This issue was closed as part of a bulk closing operation on 2015-11-20. All issues that have been resolved and where all fixVersions have been released have been closed (following discussions on the mailing list).

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Previously, when using a WriterFactory to create an HFile writer, the HFile Writer would default to using a raw byte array comparator instead of one that was aware of the a KV's Key structure. All actual instances of HFileWriter creation required the specification of a KEY_COMPARATOR. With this modification the KEY_COMPARATOR becomes the default, and we add a special comparator for unit tests that required the rare old default semantics.
